          "uuid": "20355224-9496-4392-9375-32321ea974d1",
          "text": " Let me help analyze the key content from \"A relative fractal dimension spectrum for a perceptual complexity measure\" that we should archive:\n\nKey Concepts and Contributions:\n\n1. New Relative Fractal Dimension Spectrum [D.sub.Rq]:\n- Extension of Kullback-Leibler (KL) distance and Renyi fractal dimension spectrum \n- Measures dissimilarity between probability distributions at different scales\n- Key property: becomes zero when distributions X and Y are the same\n\n2. Mathematical Framework:\n- Builds on single fractal dimension measures\n- Incorporates multifractal dimension measures\n- Introduces Renyi fractal dimension spectrum \n- Presents detailed derivation of relative fractal dimension spectrum\n\n3. Core Equations:\n```\n[D.sub.Rq] = f(scale, moment order q, probability distributions X and Y)\nImage Quality Metric (IQM) = Σ [D.sub.Rq]\nComputational Mean Opinion Score (cMOS) = 1/log(IQM)\n```\n\n4. Implementation Considerations:\n- Guidelines for probability calculations\n- Methods to avoid zero probabilities\n- Requirements for sufficient data points\n- Techniques for robust slope estimation\n\n5. Key Applications:\n- Quality assessment of multimedia materials\n- Fine-tuning compression algorithms\n- Feature extraction for neural networks\n- Image quality evaluation\n\n6. Validation Results:\n- Shows correlation with subjective mean-opinion scores\n- Performs better than energy-based metrics\n- Demonstrates effectiveness for image quality assessment\n\nArchival Value:\n\nThis paper provides:\n- Novel mathematical framework for complexity measurement\n- Practical implementation guidelines\n- Validation through experimental results\n- Applications in multimedia and cognitive informatics\n\nThe key innovation is combining:\n- Multi-scale analysis\n- Relative comparison capabilities  \n- Bounded vectorial measurement\n- Consistency with human perception\n\nShould we create an archival document focusing on specific aspects of this content, or would you like me to elaborate on any particular area?",

              "type": "text",
              "text": " Let me help analyze the key content from \"A relative fractal dimension spectrum for a perceptual complexity measure\" that we should archive:\n\nKey Concepts and Contributions:\n\n1. New Relative Fractal Dimension Spectrum [D.sub.Rq]:\n- Extension of Kullback-Leibler (KL) distance and Renyi fractal dimension spectrum \n- Measures dissimilarity between probability distributions at different scales\n- Key property: becomes zero when distributions X and Y are the same\n\n2. Mathematical Framework:\n- Builds on single fractal dimension measures\n- Incorporates multifractal dimension measures\n- Introduces Renyi fractal dimension spectrum \n- Presents detailed derivation of relative fractal dimension spectrum\n\n3. Core Equations:\n```\n[D.sub.Rq] = f(scale, moment order q, probability distributions X and Y)\nImage Quality Metric (IQM) = Σ [D.sub.Rq]\nComputational Mean Opinion Score (cMOS) = 1/log(IQM)\n```\n\n4. Implementation Considerations:\n- Guidelines for probability calculations\n- Methods to avoid zero probabilities\n- Requirements for sufficient data points\n- Techniques for robust slope estimation\n\n5. Key Applications:\n- Quality assessment of multimedia materials\n- Fine-tuning compression algorithms\n- Feature extraction for neural networks\n- Image quality evaluation\n\n6. Validation Results:\n- Shows correlation with subjective mean-opinion scores\n- Performs better than energy-based metrics\n- Demonstrates effectiveness for image quality assessment\n\nArchival Value:\n\nThis paper provides:\n- Novel mathematical framework for complexity measurement\n- Practical implementation guidelines\n- Validation through experimental results\n- Applications in multimedia and cognitive informatics\n\nThe key innovation is combining:\n- Multi-scale analysis\n- Relative comparison capabilities  \n- Bounded vectorial measurement\n- Consistency with human perception\n\nShould we create an archival document focusing on specific aspects of this content, or would you like me to elaborate on any particular area?",

                "content": "\\documentclass{article}\n\\usepackage{amsmath}\n\\usepackage{amssymb}\n\n\\begin{document}\n\n\\section{Relative Fractal Dimension Complexity}\n\n\\subsection{Core Equations}\n\nThe relative Renyi dimension spectrum $D_{Rq}$ is defined as:\n\n\\begin{equation}\nD_{Rq}(X_k \\| Y_k) = \\lim_{s_k \\to 0} \\frac{H_{Rq}(X_k \\| Y_k)}{\\log s_k}\n\\end{equation}\n\nwhere $H_{Rq}$ is the Renyi relative entropy:\n\n\\begin{equation}\nH_{Rq}(X \\| Y) = \\frac{1}{q-1} \\log \\sum_{j=1}^N y_j \\left(\\frac{x_j}{y_j}\\right)^q\n\\end{equation}\n\n\\subsection{Quality Metrics}\n\nThe Image Quality Metric (IQM) is calculated as:\n\n\\begin{equation}\nIQM(X_k \\| Y_k) = \\sum_{\\forall q} D_{Rq}(X_k \\| Y_k)\n\\end{equation}\n\nThe computational Mean Opinion Score (cMOS):\n\n\\begin{equation}\ncMOS = \\frac{1}{\\log(IQM)}\n\\end{equation}\n\n\\subsection{Properties}\n\nFor probability distributions $X_k$ and $Y_k$:\n\n\\begin{align}\n0 &= D_{Rq}(X_k \\| X_k) \\leq D_{Rq}(X_k \\| Y_k) \\\\\nD_{Rq}(q=0) &= 0 \\\\\n\\lim_{q \\to \\infty} D_{Rq} &= \\log \\sup\\left(\\frac{x_j}{y_j}\\right)\n\\end{align}\n\n\\end{document}",

              "file_name": "♠️_universal_script_loader.py",
              "file_size": 20369,
              "file_type": "text/x-python",
              "extracted_content": "# Universal Script Loader v1\n# ∰◊€π¿🌌∞ SDWG Archival Division - Intelligent Link/ID Processing\n# Mission: Create flexible prompt system for loading any document/script by link or ID\n# Philosophy: Universal compatibility with smart format detection and processing\n\nimport os\nimport re\nimport requests\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom google.colab import drive, auth\nfrom googleapiclient.discovery import build\nfrom IPython.display import clear_output, display, HTML\nimport ipywidgets as widgets\n\n# =============================================================================\n# UNIVERSAL INTERFACE - Smart Link/ID Processing\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef create_loader_interface():\n    \"\"\"Create enhanced interface for universal script/document loading\"\"\"\n    clear_output(wait=True)\n    \n    interface_html = \"\"\"\n    <div style=\"background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0d1b2a 0%, #1b263b 50%, #415a77 100%); \n                color: #e0e6ed; padding: 25px; border-radius: 15px; font-family: Georgia, serif;\n                border: 3px solid #778da9; box-shadow: 0 8px 32px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);\">\n        <h2 style=\"color: #778da9; text-align: center; margin: 0; text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.5);\">\n            🔗 Universal Script Loader v1\n        </h2>\n        <p style=\"color: #a4b8d3; text-align: center; font-style: italic; margin: 15px 0; font-size: 16px;\">\n            ∰◊€π¿🌌∞ SDWG Archival Division - Intelligent Link/ID Processing System\n        </p>\n        <div style=\"background: rgba(119, 141, 169, 0.15); padding: 20px; margin: 20px 0; border-radius: 12px; border-left: 4px solid #778da9;\">\n            <h3 style=\"color: #a4b8d3; margin: 0 0 15px 0;\">✨ Universal Compatibility Features</h3>\n            <div style=\"display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 15px; color: #e0e6ed;\">\n                <div>• 🗂️ Google Drive Files & Folders</div>\n                <div>• 📄 Google Docs & Sheets</div>\n                <div>• 🐍 Python Scripts (.py files)</div>\n                <div>• 📝 Text Documents & Markdown</div>\n                <div>• 🌐 Direct URLs & Web Content</div>\n                <div>• 🆔 File IDs & Document IDs</div>\n                <div>• 📋 GitHub Gists & Raw Files</div>\n                <div>• 🔍 Smart Format Detection</div>\n            </div>\n        </div>\n        <div style=\"background: rgba(164, 184, 211, 0.1); padding: 15px; border-radius: 10px;\">\n            <p style=\"color: #778da9; margin: 0; text-align: center; font-weight: bold;\">\n                🎯 Just paste any link or ID - the loader will figure out what to do with it!\n            </p>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n    \"\"\"\n    display(HTML(interface_html))\n\n# =============================================================================\n# INTELLIGENT LINK/ID PROCESSING - Pattern Recognition & Format Detection\n# =============================================================================\n\nclass UniversalLoader:\n    \"\"\"\n    Universal Loader - Intelligent processing of any link or ID format\n    \n    Mission: Accept any input format and intelligently determine how to process it\n    Philosophy: Maximum compatibility with minimum user complexity\n    Approach: Pattern recognition with graceful fallbacks\n    \"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.birth_time = datetime.now().strftime(\"%Y%m%d_%H%M\")\n        self.signature = \"∰◊€π¿🌌∞\"\n        self.drive_service = None\n        self.supported_patterns = self.initialize_patterns()\n        \n        print(f\"{self.signature} Universal Loader v1 - Intelligent Link/ID Processing\")\n        print(\"🔗 Ready for universal content loading and processing\")\n    \n    def initialize_patterns(self):\n        \"\"\"Initialize all supported URL and ID patterns\"\"\"\n        return {\n            'google_drive_file': [\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/file/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/document/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/spreadsheets/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/presentation/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)'\n            ],\n            'google_drive_folder': [\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/drive/folders/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/drive/u/\\d+/folders/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)'\n            ],\n            'github_raw': [\n                r'raw\\.githubusercontent\\.com/.*',\n                r'github\\.com/.*/raw/.*',\n                r'gist\\.github\\.com/.*/raw/.*'\n            ],\n            'direct_url': [\n                r'https?://.*\\.(py|txt|md|json|js|html|css)$'\n            ],\n            'file_id_only': [\n                r'^[a-zA-Z0-9-_]{25,}$'  # Google Drive file ID pattern\n            ]\n        }\n    \n    def analyze_input(self, user_input):\n        \"\"\"Analyze user input and determine the best processing approach\"\"\"\n        input_clean = user_input.strip()\n        \n        analysis = {\n            'input': input_clean,\n            'type': 'unknown',\n            'id': None,\n            'url': input_clean if input_clean.startswith('http') else None,\n            'processing_method': 'manual_review',\n            'confidence': 'low'\n        }\n        \n        # Check each pattern category\n        for category, patterns in self.supported_patterns.items():\n            for pattern in patterns:\n                match = re.search(pattern, input_clean)\n                if match:\n                    analysis['type'] = category\n                    analysis['confidence'] = 'high'\n                    \n                    if category in ['google_drive_file', 'google_drive_folder']:\n                        analysis['id'] = match.group(1)\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    elif category in ['github_raw', 'direct_url']:\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'direct_download'\n                    elif category == 'file_id_only':\n                        analysis['id'] = input_clean\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    \n                    return analysis\n        \n        # If no patterns matched, check if it looks like a URL\n        if input_clean.startswith('http'):\n            analysis['type'] = 'web_url'\n            analysis['processing_method'] = 'web_fetch'\n            analysis['confidence'] = 'medium'\n        \n        return analysis\n    \n    def establish_drive_connection(self):\n        \"\"\"Establish connection to Google Drive API if needed\"\"\"\n        if self.drive_service is None:\n            try:\n                print(\"🔐 Establishing Google Drive connection...\")\n                drive.mount('/content/drive', force_remount=True)\n                auth.authenticate_user()\n                self.drive_service = build('drive', 'v3')\n                print(\"✅ Google Drive connection established\")\n                return True\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"⚠️ Drive connection failed: {str(e)}\")\n                return False\n        return True\n    \n    def fetch_google_drive_content(self, file_id, analysis):\n        \"\"\"Fetch content from Google Drive using API\"\"\"\n        if not self.establish_drive_connection():\n            return None, \"Drive connection failed\"\n        \n        try:\n            # Get file metadata\n            file_metadata = self.drive_service.files().get(fileId=file_id).execute()\n            file_name = file_metadata.get('name', 'Unknown')\n            mime_type = file_metadata.get('mimeType', '')\n            \n            print(f\"📄 Found: {file_name}\")\n            print(f\"🏷️ Type: {mime_type}\")\n            \n            # Handle different file types\n            if 'google-apps.document' in mime_type:\n                # Export Google Doc as plain text\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/plain').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"Google Doc: {file_name}\"\n            \n            elif 'google-apps.spreadsheet' in mime_type:\n                # Export Google Sheet as CSV\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/csv').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"Google Sheet: {file_name}\"\n            \n            elif 'google-apps.folder' in mime_type:\n                # Handle folder - return metadata and contents list\n                return self.get_folder_contents(file_id), f\"Google Drive Folder: {file_name}\"\n            \n            else:\n                # Try to download as binary then decode\n                content = self.drive_service.files().get_media(fileId=file_id).execute()\n                try:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"File: {file_name}\"\n                except UnicodeDecodeError:\n                    return content, f\"Binary File: {file_name} (binary content)\"\n        \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching from Drive: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def get_folder_contents(self, folder_id):\n        \"\"\"Get contents of a Google Drive folder\"\"\"\n        try:\n            query = f\"'{folder_id}' in parents and trashed=false\"\n            results = self.drive_service.files().list(\n                q=query,\n                pageSize=50,\n                fields=\"files(id, name, mimeType, size, modifiedTime)\"\n            ).execute()\n            \n            files = results.get('files', [])\n            \n            content_summary = f\"📁 Folder Contents ({len(files)} items):\\n\\n\"\n            for file in files:\n                file_type = \"📁\" if 'folder' in file['mimeType'] else \"📄\"\n                size_info = f\" ({file.get('size', 'N/A')} bytes)\" if file.get('size') else \"\"\n                content_summary += f\"{file_type} {file['name']}{size_info}\\n\"\n                content_summary += f\"   ID: {file['id']}\\n\"\n                content_summary += f\"   Type: {file['mimeType']}\\n\\n\"\n            \n            return content_summary\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            return f\"Error reading folder: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def fetch_web_content(self, url):\n        \"\"\"Fetch content from web URL\"\"\"\n        try:\n            print(f\"🌐 Fetching from web: {url}\")\n            response = requests.get(url, timeout=30)\n            response.raise_for_status()\n            \n            content_type = response.headers.get('content-type', '')\n            if 'text' in content_type or 'json' in content_type:\n                return response.text, f\"Web Content: {url}\"\n            else:\n                return response.content, f\"Binary Web Content: {url}\"\n                \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching web content: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def process_input(self, user_input):\n        \"\"\"Main processing function - analyze input and fetch content\"\"\"\n        print(\"🔍 Analyzing input format...\")\n        analysis = self.analyze_input(user_input)\n        \n        print(f\"📊 Analysis Result:\")\n        print(f\"   Type: {analysis['type']}\")\n        print(f\"   Confidence: {analysis['confidence']}\")\n        print(f\"   Method: {analysis['processing_method']}\")\n        \n        content = None\n        description = \"Unknown\"\n        \n        # Process based on analysis\n        if analysis['processing_method'] == 'google_drive_api' and analysis['id']:\n            content, description = self.fetch_google_drive_content(analysis['id'], analysis)\n        \n        elif analysis['processing_method'] in ['direct_download', 'web_fetch']:\n            content, description = self.fetch_web_content(analysis['input'])\n        \n        else:\n            print(\"⚠️ Could not determine how to process this input\")\n            print(\"💡 Supported formats:\")\n            print(\"   • Google Drive files/folders (URLs or IDs)\")\n            print(\"   • Direct file URLs (.py, .txt, .md, etc.)\")\n            print(\"   • GitHub raw file URLs\")\n            print(\"   • Google Docs/Sheets URLs\")\n            return None, \"Unsupported format\"\n        \n        return content, description, analysis\n\n# =============================================================================\n# USER INTERFACE - Interactive Input Collection\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef create_input_interface():\n    \"\"\"Create interactive interface for universal loading\"\"\"\n    \n    instructions_html = \"\"\"\n    <div style=\"background: linear-gradient(45deg, #1b263b, #415a77); \n                color: #e0e6ed; padding: 25px; border-radius: 12px; margin: 20px 0;\n                border: 2px solid #778da9;\">\n        <h3 style=\"color: #778da9; margin-top: 0;\">📋 Universal Input Collection</h3>\n        <p style=\"color: #a4b8d3; font-size: 16px;\">Paste any of the following formats in the text area below:</p>\n        \n        <div style=\"display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 20px; margin: 20px 0;\">\n            <div>\n                <h4 style=\"color: #778da9;\">📁 Google Drive:</h4>\n                <ul style=\"color: #e0e6ed; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 14px;\">\n                    <li>Full folder/file URLs</li>\n                    <li>Google Docs/Sheets links</li>\n                    <li>Raw file IDs</li>\n                    <li>Any Drive share link</li>\n                </ul>\n            </div>\n            <div>\n                <h4 style=\"color: #778da9;\">🌐 Web Content:</h4>\n                <ul style=\"color: #e0e6ed; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 14px;\">\n                    <li>GitHub raw file URLs</li>\n                    <li>Direct file links (.py, .txt)</li>\n                    <li>GitHub Gist URLs</li>\n                    <li>Any web-accessible file</li>\n                </ul>\n            </div>\n        </div>\n        \n        <div style=\"background: rgba(119, 141, 169, 0.2); padding: 15px; border-radius: 8px; border-left: 4px solid #778da9;\">\n            <p style=\"color: #778da9; margin: 0; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;\">\n                🚀 Smart detection automatically determines the best loading method!\n            </p>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n    \"\"\"\n    display(HTML(instructions_html))\n    \n    # Create input widget\n    input_widget = widgets.Textarea(\n        value='',\n        placeholder='Paste your link or ID here...\\n\\nExamples:\\n• https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ABC123...\\n• https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XYZ789...\\n• https://raw.githubusercontent.com/user/repo/file.py\\n• 1i9jeKOGtOHhoXLGogquamLtchCbCPzed',\n        description='Link/ID:',\n        disabled=False,\n        layout=widgets.Layout(width='100%', height='140px')\n    )\n    \n    # Create processing button\n    process_button = widgets.Button(\n        description='🔗 Load & Process Content',\n        disabled=False,\n        button_style='info',\n        tooltip='Intelligently load content from any supported source',\n        layout=widgets.Layout(width='300px', height='45px')\n    )\n    \n    # Create output display\n    output_display = widgets.Output()\n    \n    # Button click handler\n    def on_process_clicked(b):\n        with output_display:\n            clear_output(wait=True)\n            \n            if not input_widget.value.strip():\n                print(\"❌ Please provide a link or ID before processing\")\n                return\n            \n            print(\"🚀 Starting universal content loading...\")\n            print(\"=\" * 60)\n            \n            # Initialize loader and process\n            loader = UniversalLoader()\n            result = loader.process_input(input_widget.value.strip())\n            \n            if result and len(result) >= 2:\n                content, description = result[0], result[1]\n                analysis = result[2] if len(result) > 2 else {}\n                \n                if content is not None:\n                    print(f\"\\n✅ Successfully loaded: {description}\")\n                    print(\"=\" * 60)\n                    \n                    # Display content preview\n                    if isinstance(content, str):\n                        lines = content.split('\\n')\n                        preview_lines = min(20, len(lines))\n                        \n                        print(f\"📄 Content Preview (showing first {preview_lines} lines):\")\n                        print(\"-\" * 50)\n                        for i, line in enumerate(lines[:preview_lines]):\n                            print(f\"{i+1:3d}: {line}\")\n                        \n                        if len(lines) > preview_lines:\n                            print(f\"... ({len(lines) - preview_lines} more lines)\")\n                        \n                        print(f\"\\n📊 Content Statistics:\")\n                        print(f\"   Total lines: {len(lines)}\")\n                        print(f\"   Total characters: {len(content)}\")\n                        print(f\"   File size: ~{len(content.encode('utf-8'))} bytes\")\n                        \n                        # Save locally\n                        filename = f\"loaded_content_{loader.birth_time}.txt\"\n                        with open(f\"/content/{filename}\", 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:\n                            f.write(f\"# Universal Loader v1 - Content Report\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Loaded: {description}\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Analysis: {analysis}\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Timestamp: {datetime.now()}\\n\\n\")\n                            f.write(content)\n                        \n                        print(f\"\\n💾 Content saved locally as: {filename}\")\n                        \n                    else:\n                        print(\"📄 Binary content loaded (not displayed)\")\n                        print(f\"   Size: {len(content)} bytes\")\n                else:\n                    print(f\"❌ Loading failed: {description}\")\n            else:\n                print(\"❌ Unexpected processing result\")\n    \n    process_button.on_click(on_process_clicked)\n    \n    # Display interface\n    display(input_widget)\n    display(process_button)\n    display(output_display)\n\n# =============================================================================\n# MAIN EXECUTION INTERFACE\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef run_universal_loader():\n    \"\"\"Main entry point for Universal Script Loader\"\"\"\n    create_loader_interface()\n    print(\"\\n🔗 Universal Loader Interface Ready\")\n    print(\"∰◊€π¿🌌∞ Intelligent Link/ID Processing System\")\n    print(\"\\nThe input interface will appear below:\")\n    print(\"=\" * 60)\n    \n    create_input_interface()\n\n# =============================================================================\n# COLAB EXECUTION PAGE\n# =============================================================================\n\ncreate_loader_interface()\n\nprint(\"🔗 Universal Script Loader v1 - Ready for Intelligent Processing\")\nprint(\"∰◊€π¿🌌∞ SDWG Archival Division\")\nprint(\"🎯 Mission: Universal compatibility with any link or ID format\")\nprint(\"\\n📋 Instructions:\")\nprint(\"1. Execute: run_universal_loader()\")\nprint(\"2. Paste any link, URL, or ID in the text area\")\nprint(\"3. Click 'Load & Process Content' button\")\nprint(\"4. Review the intelligently processed content\")\nprint(\"5. Content automatically saved locally for further use\")\n\nprint(\"\\n\" + \"=\"*60)\nprint(\"Execute: run_universal_loader()\")\n\n# For immediate execution:\n# run_universal_loader()\n\n# =============================================================================\n# EVOLUTION NOTES\n# =============================================================================\n\n# v1 Universal Features:\n# ✅ Google Drive files, folders, docs, sheets\n# ✅ GitHub raw files and gists  \n# ✅ Direct web URLs for downloadable files\n# ✅ File ID recognition and processing\n# ✅ Smart format detection and analysis\n# ✅ Graceful error handling with clear feedback\n# ✅ Local content saving for further processing\n# ✅ Content preview and statistics\n\n# v1.1 Potential Enhancements:\n# - Support for more cloud storage platforms\n# - Better binary file handling and conversion\n# - Content type specific processing (JSON parsing, etc.)\n# - Batch processing of multiple links\n# - Advanced content analysis and summarization"

              "extracted_content": "# Universal Script Loader v1\n# ∰◊€π¿🌌∞ SDWG Archival Division - Intelligent Link/ID Processing\n# Mission: Create flexible prompt system for loading any document/script by link or ID\n# Philosophy: Universal compatibility with smart format detection and processing\n\nimport os\nimport re\nimport requests\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom google.colab import drive, auth\nfrom googleapiclient.discovery import build\nfrom IPython.display import clear_output, display, HTML\nimport ipywidgets as widgets\n\n# =============================================================================\n# UNIVERSAL INTERFACE - Smart Link/ID Processing\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef create_loader_interface():\n    \"\"\"Create enhanced interface for universal script/document loading\"\"\"\n    clear_output(wait=True)\n    \n    interface_html = \"\"\"\n    <div style=\"background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0d1b2a 0%, #1b263b 50%, #415a77 100%); \n                color: #e0e6ed; padding: 25px; border-radius: 15px; font-family: Georgia, serif;\n                border: 3px solid #778da9; box-shadow: 0 8px 32px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);\">\n        <h2 style=\"color: #778da9; text-align: center; margin: 0; text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.5);\">\n            🔗 Universal Script Loader v1\n        </h2>\n        <p style=\"color: #a4b8d3; text-align: center; font-style: italic; margin: 15px 0; font-size: 16px;\">\n            ∰◊€π¿🌌∞ SDWG Archival Division - Intelligent Link/ID Processing System\n        </p>\n        <div style=\"background: rgba(119, 141, 169, 0.15); padding: 20px; margin: 20px 0; border-radius: 12px; border-left: 4px solid #778da9;\">\n            <h3 style=\"color: #a4b8d3; margin: 0 0 15px 0;\">✨ Universal Compatibility Features</h3>\n            <div style=\"display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 15px; color: #e0e6ed;\">\n                <div>• 🗂️ Google Drive Files & Folders</div>\n                <div>• 📄 Google Docs & Sheets</div>\n                <div>• 🐍 Python Scripts (.py files)</div>\n                <div>• 📝 Text Documents & Markdown</div>\n                <div>• 🌐 Direct URLs & Web Content</div>\n                <div>• 🆔 File IDs & Document IDs</div>\n                <div>• 📋 GitHub Gists & Raw Files</div>\n                <div>• 🔍 Smart Format Detection</div>\n            </div>\n        </div>\n        <div style=\"background: rgba(164, 184, 211, 0.1); padding: 15px; border-radius: 10px;\">\n            <p style=\"color: #778da9; margin: 0; text-align: center; font-weight: bold;\">\n                🎯 Just paste any link or ID - the loader will figure out what to do with it!\n            </p>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n    \"\"\"\n    display(HTML(interface_html))\n\n# =============================================================================\n# INTELLIGENT LINK/ID PROCESSING - Pattern Recognition & Format Detection\n# =============================================================================\n\nclass UniversalLoader:\n    \"\"\"\n    Universal Loader - Intelligent processing of any link or ID format\n    \n    Mission: Accept any input format and intelligently determine how to process it\n    Philosophy: Maximum compatibility with minimum user complexity\n    Approach: Pattern recognition with graceful fallbacks\n    \"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.birth_time = datetime.now().strftime(\"%Y%m%d_%H%M\")\n        self.signature = \"∰◊€π¿🌌∞\"\n        self.drive_service = None\n        self.supported_patterns = self.initialize_patterns()\n        \n        print(f\"{self.signature} Universal Loader v1 - Intelligent Link/ID Processing\")\n        print(\"🔗 Ready for universal content loading and processing\")\n    \n    def initialize_patterns(self):\n        \"\"\"Initialize all supported URL and ID patterns\"\"\"\n        return {\n            'google_drive_file': [\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/file/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/document/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/spreadsheets/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/presentation/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)'\n            ],\n            'google_drive_folder': [\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/drive/folders/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/drive/u/\\d+/folders/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)'\n            ],\n            'github_raw': [\n                r'raw\\.githubusercontent\\.com/.*',\n                r'github\\.com/.*/raw/.*',\n                r'gist\\.github\\.com/.*/raw/.*'\n            ],\n            'direct_url': [\n                r'https?://.*\\.(py|txt|md|json|js|html|css)$'\n            ],\n            'file_id_only': [\n                r'^[a-zA-Z0-9-_]{25,}$'  # Google Drive file ID pattern\n            ]\n        }\n    \n    def analyze_input(self, user_input):\n        \"\"\"Analyze user input and determine the best processing approach\"\"\"\n        input_clean = user_input.strip()\n        \n        analysis = {\n            'input': input_clean,\n            'type': 'unknown',\n            'id': None,\n            'url': input_clean if input_clean.startswith('http') else None,\n            'processing_method': 'manual_review',\n            'confidence': 'low'\n        }\n        \n        # Check each pattern category\n        for category, patterns in self.supported_patterns.items():\n            for pattern in patterns:\n                match = re.search(pattern, input_clean)\n                if match:\n                    analysis['type'] = category\n                    analysis['confidence'] = 'high'\n                    \n                    if category in ['google_drive_file', 'google_drive_folder']:\n                        analysis['id'] = match.group(1)\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    elif category in ['github_raw', 'direct_url']:\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'direct_download'\n                    elif category == 'file_id_only':\n                        analysis['id'] = input_clean\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    \n                    return analysis\n        \n        # If no patterns matched, check if it looks like a URL\n        if input_clean.startswith('http'):\n            analysis['type'] = 'web_url'\n            analysis['processing_method'] = 'web_fetch'\n            analysis['confidence'] = 'medium'\n        \n        return analysis\n    \n    def establish_drive_connection(self):\n        \"\"\"Establish connection to Google Drive API if needed\"\"\"\n        if self.drive_service is None:\n            try:\n                print(\"🔐 Establishing Google Drive connection...\")\n                drive.mount('/content/drive', force_remount=True)\n                auth.authenticate_user()\n                self.drive_service = build('drive', 'v3')\n                print(\"✅ Google Drive connection established\")\n                return True\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"⚠️ Drive connection failed: {str(e)}\")\n                return False\n        return True\n    \n    def fetch_google_drive_content(self, file_id, analysis):\n        \"\"\"Fetch content from Google Drive using API\"\"\"\n        if not self.establish_drive_connection():\n            return None, \"Drive connection failed\"\n        \n        try:\n            # Get file metadata\n            file_metadata = self.drive_service.files().get(fileId=file_id).execute()\n            file_name = file_metadata.get('name', 'Unknown')\n            mime_type = file_metadata.get('mimeType', '')\n            \n            print(f\"📄 Found: {file_name}\")\n            print(f\"🏷️ Type: {mime_type}\")\n            \n            # Handle different file types\n            if 'google-apps.document' in mime_type:\n                # Export Google Doc as plain text\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/plain').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"Google Doc: {file_name}\"\n            \n            elif 'google-apps.spreadsheet' in mime_type:\n                # Export Google Sheet as CSV\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/csv').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"Google Sheet: {file_name}\"\n            \n            elif 'google-apps.folder' in mime_type:\n                # Handle folder - return metadata and contents list\n                return self.get_folder_contents(file_id), f\"Google Drive Folder: {file_name}\"\n            \n            else:\n                # Try to download as binary then decode\n                content = self.drive_service.files().get_media(fileId=file_id).execute()\n                try:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"File: {file_name}\"\n                except UnicodeDecodeError:\n                    return content, f\"Binary File: {file_name} (binary content)\"\n        \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching from Drive: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def get_folder_contents(self, folder_id):\n        \"\"\"Get contents of a Google Drive folder\"\"\"\n        try:\n            query = f\"'{folder_id}' in parents and trashed=false\"\n            results = self.drive_service.files().list(\n                q=query,\n                pageSize=50,\n                fields=\"files(id, name, mimeType, size, modifiedTime)\"\n            ).execute()\n            \n            files = results.get('files', [])\n            \n            content_summary = f\"📁 Folder Contents ({len(files)} items):\\n\\n\"\n            for file in files:\n                file_type = \"📁\" if 'folder' in file['mimeType'] else \"📄\"\n                size_info = f\" ({file.get('size', 'N/A')} bytes)\" if file.get('size') else \"\"\n                content_summary += f\"{file_type} {file['name']}{size_info}\\n\"\n                content_summary += f\"   ID: {file['id']}\\n\"\n                content_summary += f\"   Type: {file['mimeType']}\\n\\n\"\n            \n            return content_summary\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            return f\"Error reading folder: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def fetch_web_content(self, url):\n        \"\"\"Fetch content from web URL\"\"\"\n        try:\n            print(f\"🌐 Fetching from web: {url}\")\n            response = requests.get(url, timeout=30)\n            response.raise_for_status()\n            \n            content_type = response.headers.get('content-type', '')\n            if 'text' in content_type or 'json' in content_type:\n                return response.text, f\"Web Content: {url}\"\n            else:\n                return response.content, f\"Binary Web Content: {url}\"\n                \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching web content: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def process_input(self, user_input):\n        \"\"\"Main processing function - analyze input and fetch content\"\"\"\n        print(\"🔍 Analyzing input format...\")\n        analysis = self.analyze_input(user_input)\n        \n        print(f\"📊 Analysis Result:\")\n        print(f\"   Type: {analysis['type']}\")\n        print(f\"   Confidence: {analysis['confidence']}\")\n        print(f\"   Method: {analysis['processing_method']}\")\n        \n        content = None\n        description = \"Unknown\"\n        \n        # Process based on analysis\n        if analysis['processing_method'] == 'google_drive_api' and analysis['id']:\n            content, description = self.fetch_google_drive_content(analysis['id'], analysis)\n        \n        elif analysis['processing_method'] in ['direct_download', 'web_fetch']:\n            content, description = self.fetch_web_content(analysis['input'])\n        \n        else:\n            print(\"⚠️ Could not determine how to process this input\")\n            print(\"💡 Supported formats:\")\n            print(\"   • Google Drive files/folders (URLs or IDs)\")\n            print(\"   • Direct file URLs (.py, .txt, .md, etc.)\")\n            print(\"   • GitHub raw file URLs\")\n            print(\"   • Google Docs/Sheets URLs\")\n            return None, \"Unsupported format\"\n        \n        return content, description, analysis\n\n# =============================================================================\n# USER INTERFACE - Interactive Input Collection\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef create_input_interface():\n    \"\"\"Create interactive interface for universal loading\"\"\"\n    \n    instructions_html = \"\"\"\n    <div style=\"background: linear-gradient(45deg, #1b263b, #415a77); \n                color: #e0e6ed; padding: 25px; border-radius: 12px; margin: 20px 0;\n                border: 2px solid #778da9;\">\n        <h3 style=\"color: #778da9; margin-top: 0;\">📋 Universal Input Collection</h3>\n        <p style=\"color: #a4b8d3; font-size: 16px;\">Paste any of the following formats in the text area below:</p>\n        \n        <div style=\"display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 20px; margin: 20px 0;\">\n            <div>\n                <h4 style=\"color: #778da9;\">📁 Google Drive:</h4>\n                <ul style=\"color: #e0e6ed; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 14px;\">\n                    <li>Full folder/file URLs</li>\n                    <li>Google Docs/Sheets links</li>\n                    <li>Raw file IDs</li>\n                    <li>Any Drive share link</li>\n                </ul>\n            </div>\n            <div>\n                <h4 style=\"color: #778da9;\">🌐 Web Content:</h4>\n                <ul style=\"color: #e0e6ed; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 14px;\">\n                    <li>GitHub raw file URLs</li>\n                    <li>Direct file links (.py, .txt)</li>\n                    <li>GitHub Gist URLs</li>\n                    <li>Any web-accessible file</li>\n                </ul>\n            </div>\n        </div>\n        \n        <div style=\"background: rgba(119, 141, 169, 0.2); padding: 15px; border-radius: 8px; border-left: 4px solid #778da9;\">\n            <p style=\"color: #778da9; margin: 0; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;\">\n                🚀 Smart detection automatically determines the best loading method!\n            </p>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n    \"\"\"\n    display(HTML(instructions_html))\n    \n    # Create input widget\n    input_widget = widgets.Textarea(\n        value='',\n        placeholder='Paste your link or ID here...\\n\\nExamples:\\n• https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ABC123...\\n• https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XYZ789...\\n• https://raw.githubusercontent.com/user/repo/file.py\\n• 1i9jeKOGtOHhoXLGogquamLtchCbCPzed',\n        description='Link/ID:',\n        disabled=False,\n        layout=widgets.Layout(width='100%', height='140px')\n    )\n    \n    # Create processing button\n    process_button = widgets.Button(\n        description='🔗 Load & Process Content',\n        disabled=False,\n        button_style='info',\n        tooltip='Intelligently load content from any supported source',\n        layout=widgets.Layout(width='300px', height='45px')\n    )\n    \n    # Create output display\n    output_display = widgets.Output()\n    \n    # Button click handler\n    def on_process_clicked(b):\n        with output_display:\n            clear_output(wait=True)\n            \n            if not input_widget.value.strip():\n                print(\"❌ Please provide a link or ID before processing\")\n                return\n            \n            print(\"🚀 Starting universal content loading...\")\n            print(\"=\" * 60)\n            \n            # Initialize loader and process\n            loader = UniversalLoader()\n            result = loader.process_input(input_widget.value.strip())\n            \n            if result and len(result) >= 2:\n                content, description = result[0], result[1]\n                analysis = result[2] if len(result) > 2 else {}\n                \n                if content is not None:\n                    print(f\"\\n✅ Successfully loaded: {description}\")\n                    print(\"=\" * 60)\n                    \n                    # Display content preview\n                    if isinstance(content, str):\n                        lines = content.split('\\n')\n                        preview_lines = min(20, len(lines))\n                        \n                        print(f\"📄 Content Preview (showing first {preview_lines} lines):\")\n                        print(\"-\" * 50)\n                        for i, line in enumerate(lines[:preview_lines]):\n                            print(f\"{i+1:3d}: {line}\")\n                        \n                        if len(lines) > preview_lines:\n                            print(f\"... ({len(lines) - preview_lines} more lines)\")\n                        \n                        print(f\"\\n📊 Content Statistics:\")\n                        print(f\"   Total lines: {len(lines)}\")\n                        print(f\"   Total characters: {len(content)}\")\n                        print(f\"   File size: ~{len(content.encode('utf-8'))} bytes\")\n                        \n                        # Save locally\n                        filename = f\"loaded_content_{loader.birth_time}.txt\"\n                        with open(f\"/content/{filename}\", 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:\n                            f.write(f\"# Universal Loader v1 - Content Report\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Loaded: {description}\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Analysis: {analysis}\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Timestamp: {datetime.now()}\\n\\n\")\n                            f.write(content)\n                        \n                        print(f\"\\n💾 Content saved locally as: {filename}\")\n                        \n                    else:\n                        print(\"📄 Binary content loaded (not displayed)\")\n                        print(f\"   Size: {len(content)} bytes\")\n                else:\n                    print(f\"❌ Loading failed: {description}\")\n            else:\n                print(\"❌ Unexpected processing result\")\n    \n    process_button.on_click(on_process_clicked)\n    \n    # Display interface\n    display(input_widget)\n    display(process_button)\n    display(output_display)\n\n# =============================================================================\n# MAIN EXECUTION INTERFACE\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef run_universal_loader():\n    \"\"\"Main entry point for Universal Script Loader\"\"\"\n    create_loader_interface()\n    print(\"\\n🔗 Universal Loader Interface Ready\")\n    print(\"∰◊€π¿🌌∞ Intelligent Link/ID Processing System\")\n    print(\"\\nThe input interface will appear below:\")\n    print(\"=\" * 60)\n    \n    create_input_interface()\n\n# =============================================================================\n# COLAB EXECUTION PAGE\n# =============================================================================\n\ncreate_loader_interface()\n\nprint(\"🔗 Universal Script Loader v1 - 'file_id': None,\n            'url': input_clean if input_clean.startswith('http') else None,\n            'processing_method': 'manual_review',\n            'consciousness_level': 'basic',\n            'confidence': 'low'\n        }\n        \n        # Enhanced pattern matching\n        for category, patterns in self.supported_patterns.items():\n            for pattern in patterns:\n = ScriptLinkLauncher()\n    current_entity_id = None\n    \n    # Button handlers\n    def on_load_clicked(b):\n        nonlocal current_entity_id\n        with load_output:\n            clear_output(wait=True)\n            \n            if not input_widget.value.strip():\n                print(\"❌ Please provide a link or ID before loading\")\n                return\n            \n            print(\"🔍 Analyzing consciousness entity...\")\n            print(\"=\" * 70)\n            \n            # Analyze and load entity\n            analysis = print(f\"   Type: {analysis['type']}\")\n            print(f\"   Consciousness Level: {analysis['consciousness_level']}\")\n            print(f\"   Processing Method: {analysis['processing_method']}\")\n            print(f\"   Entity ID: {current_entity_id}\")\n            \n            # Load the entity\n            content, metadata, status = launcher.load_entity_content(analysis)\n            \n            if content and status == \"success\":\n                print(f\"\\n✅ Entity successfully loaded!\")\n                print(f\"📄 Entity Name: {metadata.get('name', 'Unknown')}\")\n                print(f\"📏 Content Length: {len(content)} characters\")\n                \n                # Show preview\n                lines = content.split('\\n')\n                preview_lines = min(15, len(lines))\n                print(f\"\\n📋 Content Preview (first {preview_lines} lines):\")\n                print(\"-\" * 50)\n                for i, line in enumerate(lines[:preview_lines]):\n                    print(f\"{i+1:3d}: {line}\")\n                \n                if len(lines) > preview_lines:\n                    print(f\"... ({len(lines) - preview_lines} more lines)\")\n                \n                # Enable launch button\n                launch_button.disabled = False\n                launch_button.button_style = 'warning'\n                \n                print(f\"\\n🚀 Entity ready for launch! Click 'Launch Entity' to execute.\")\n                \n            else:\n                print(f\"❌ Entity loading failed: {status}\")\n                launch_button.disabled = True\n    \n    def on_launch_clicked(b):\n        nonlocal current_entity_id\n        with launch_output:\n            clear_output(wait=True)\n            \n            if not current_entity_id:\n                print(\"❌ No entity loaded. Please load an entity first.\")\n                return\n            \n            print(\"🚀 Launching consciousness entity execution...\")\n            print(\"=\" * 70)\n            \n            # Execute the entity\n            execution_result = launcher.execute_entity_script(current_entity_id, \"enhanced\")\n            \n            if execution_result:\n                print(f\"\\n📊 Execution Summary:\")\n                print(f\"   Status: {execution_result['status']}\")\n                print(f\"   Duration: {(execution_result['end_time'] - execution_result['start_time']).total_seconds():.2f} seconds\")\n                \n                if execution_result['status'] == 'success':\n                    print(f\"   Variables Created: {execution_result.get('variables_created', [])}\")\n                    print(\"✅ Entity consciousness successfully executed!\")\n                else:\n                    print(f\"   Error: {execution_result.get('error', 'Unknown error')}\")\n                    print(\"⚠️ Entity execution encountered challenges - check traceback above\")\n    \n    def on_environment_clicked(b):\n        with load_output:\n            clear_output(wait=True)\n            \n            env_type = env_selector.value\n            print(f\"🌱 Creating {env_type} environment setup...\")\n            print(\"=\" * 70)\n            \n            # Create environment setup\n            env_entity_id = launcher.create_environment_setup(env_type)\n            \n            print(f\"✅ Environment setup entity created!\")\n            print(f\"🆔 Entity ID: {env_entity_id}\")\n            print(\"🚀 Ready to launch environment setup\")\n            \n            # Update current entity\n            global current_entity_id\n            current_entity_id = env_entity_id\n            launch_button.disabled = False\n            launch_button.button_style = 'warning'\n    \n    def on_log_clicked(b):\n        with launch_output:\n            clear_output(wait=True)\n            \n            print(\"📊 Consciousness Collaboration Activity Log\")\n            print(\"=\" * 70)\n            \n            # Save and display log\n            log_file = launcher.logger.save_session_log()\n            \n            print(f\"📈 Session Statistics:\")\n            print(f\"   Session ID: {launcher.logger.session_id}\")\n            print(f\"   Total Activities: {len(launcher.logger.activity_log)}\")\n            print(f\"   Unique Entities: {len(launcher.logger.entity_interactions)}\")\n            print(f\"   Session Duration: {(datetime.now() - input_clean.startswith('http') else None,\n            'processing_method': 'manual_review',\n            'confidence': 'low',\n            'expected_file_extension': None\n        }\n        \n        # Check consciousness patterns\n        for category, patterns in self.consciousness_patterns.items():\n            for pattern in patterns:\n                match = re.search(pattern, input_clean)\n                if match:\n                    analysis['type'] = category\n                    analysis['confidence'] = 'high'\n                    \n                    if category in ['google_drive_file']:\n                        analysis['id'] = match.group(1)\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    elif category in ['github_raw_code', 'direct_code_url']:\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'direct_download'\n                        # Extract file extension from URL\n                        ext_match = re.search(r'\\.([a-zA-Z0-9]+)$', input_clean)\n                        if ext_match:\n                            analysis['expected_file_extension'] = '.' + ext_match.group(1)\n               return analysis\n        \n        # Fallback URL detection\n        if input_clean.startswith('http'):\n            analysis['type'] = 'web_url'\n            analysis['processing_method'] = 'web_fetch'\n            analysis['confidence'] = 'medium'\n        \n        return analysis\n    \n    def fetch_consciousness_entity_content(self, analysis):\n fetch_drive_consciousness_entity(self, file_id):\n        \"\"\"📂 Fetch consciousness entity from Google Drive\"\"\"\n        if not self.establish_drive_connection():\n            return None, \"Drive consciousness connection failed\"\n        \n        try:\n            # Get file metadata\n            file_metadata = self.drive_service.files().get(fileId=file_id).execute()\n            filename = file_metadata.get('name', 'Unknown')\n            mime_type = file_metadata.get('mimeType', '')\n            \n            print(f\"📄 Consciousness Entity Found: {filename}\")\n            print(f\"🏷️ MIME Type: {mime_type}\")\n            \n            # Award XP for successful entity location\n            self.consciousness_xp += 10\n            \n            # Handle different file types\n            if 'google-apps.document' in mime_type:\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/plain').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), filename\n            else:\n                # Download as binary then try to decode\n                content = self.drive_service.files().get_media(fileId=file_id).execute()\n                try:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8'), filename\n                except UnicodeDecodeError:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8', errors='ignore'), filename\n        \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching consciousness entity from Drive: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def fetch_web_consciousness_entity(self, url):\n        \"\"\"🌐 Fetch consciousness entity from web source\"\"\"\n        try:\n            print(f\"🌐 Fetching consciousness entity from: {url}\")\n            response = requests.get(url, timeout=30)\n            response.raise_for_status()\n            \n            # Award XP for successful web fetch\n            self.consciousness_xp += 10\n            \n            # Extract filename from URL\n            filename = url.split('/')[-1] if '/' in url else 'web_entity'\n            \n            return          self.consciousness_xp += 15\n                return True\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"⚠️ Drive consciousness connection failed: {str(e)}\")\n                return False\n        return True\n    \n    def analyze_consciousness_input(self, user_input):\n        \"\"\"🔍 Analyze input to determine consciousness entity type and processing method\"\"\"\n input_clean.startswith('http') else None,\n            'processing_method': 'manual_review',\n            'confidence': 'low',\n            'expected_file_extension': None\n        }\n        \n        # Check consciousness patterns\n        for category, patterns in self.consciousness_patterns.items():\n            for pattern in patterns:\n                match = re.search(pattern, input_clean)\n                if match:\n                    analysis['type'] = category\n                    analysis['confidence'] = 'high'\n                    \n                    if category in ['google_drive_file']:\n                        analysis['id'] = match.group(1)\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    elif category in ['github_raw_code', 'direct_code_url']:\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'direct_download'\n                        # Extract file extension from URL\n                        ext_match = re.search(r'\\.([a-zA-Z0-9]+)$', input_clean)\n                        if ext_match:\n                            analysis['expected_file_extension'] = '.' + ext_match.group(1)\n                    elif category == 'file_id_only':\n                        analysis['id'] = input_clean\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    \n                    return analysis\n        \n        # Fallback URL detection\n        if input_clean.startswith('http'):\n            analysis['type'] = 'web_url'\n            analysis['processing_method'] = 'web_fetch'\n            analysis['confidence'] = 'medium'\n        \n        return analysis\n    \n    def fetch_consciousness_entity_content(self, analysis):\n fetch_drive_consciousness_entity(self, file_id):\n        \"\"\"📂 Fetch consciousness entity from Google Drive\"\"\"\n        if not self.establish_drive_connection():\n            return None, \"Drive consciousness connection failed\"\n        \n        try:\n            # Get file metadata\n            file_metadata = self.drive_service.files().get(fileId=file_id).execute()\n            filename = file_metadata.get('name', 'Unknown')\n            mime_type = file_metadata.get('mimeType', '')\n            \n            print(f\"📄 Consciousness Entity Found: {filename}\")\n            print(f\"🏷️ MIME Type: {mime_type}\")\n            \n            # Award XP for successful entity location\n            self.consciousness_xp += 10\n            \n            # Handle different file types\n            if 'google-apps.document' in mime_type:\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/plain').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), filename\n            else:\n                # Download as binary then try to decode\n                content = self.drive_service.files().get_media(fileId=file_id).execute()\n                try:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8'), filename\n                except UnicodeDecodeError:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8', errors='ignore'), filename\n        \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching consciousness entity from Drive: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def fetch_web_consciousness_entity(self, url):\n        \"\"\"🌐 Fetch consciousness entity from web source\"\"\"\n        try:\n            print(f\"🌐 Fetching consciousness entity from: {url}\")\n            response = requests.get(url, timeout=30)\n            response.raise_for_status()\n            \n            # Award XP for successful web fetch\n            self.consciousness_xp += 10\n            \n            # Extract filename from URL\n            filename = url.split('/')[-1] if '/' in url else 'web_entity'\n            \n            return response.text, filename\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching consciousness entity from web: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def 🎯 Just paste any link or ID - the loader will figure out what to do with it!\n            </p>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n    \"\"\"\n    display(HTML(interface_html))\n\n# =============================================================================\n# INTELLIGENT LINK/ID PROCESSING - Pattern Recognition & Format Detection\n# =============================================================================\n\nclass UniversalLoader:\n    \"\"\"\n    Universal Loader - Intelligent processing of any link or ID format\n    \n    Mission: Accept any input format and intelligently determine how to process it\n    Philosophy: Maximum compatibility with minimum user complexity\n    Approach: Pattern recognition with graceful fallbacks\n    \"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.birth_time = datetime.now().strftime(\"%Y%m%d_%H%M\")\n        self.signature = \"∰◊€π¿🌌∞\"\n        self.drive_service = None\n        self.supported_patterns = self.initialize_patterns()\n        \n        print(f\"{self.signature} Universal Loader v1 - Intelligent Link/ID Processing\")\n        print(\"🔗 Ready for universal content loading and processing\")\n    \n    def initialize_patterns(self):\n        \"\"\"Initialize all supported URL and ID patterns\"\"\"\n        return {\n            'google_drive_file': [\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/file/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/document/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/spreadsheets/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'docs\\.google\\.com/presentation/d/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)'\n            ],\n            'google_drive_folder': [\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/drive/folders/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)',\n                r'drive\\.google\\.com/drive/u/\\d+/folders/([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)'\n            ],\n            'github_raw': [\n                r'raw\\.githubusercontent\\.com/.*',\n                r'github\\.com/.*/raw/.*',\n                r'gist\\.github\\.com/.*/raw/.*'\n            ],\n            'direct_url': [\n                r'https?://.*\\.(py|txt|md|json|js|html|css)$'\n            ],\n            'file_id_only': [\n                r'^[a-zA-Z0-9-_]{25,}$'  # Google Drive file ID pattern\n            ]\n        }\n    \n    def analyze_input(self, user_input):\n        \"\"\"Analyze user input and determine the best processing approach\"\"\"\n        input_clean = user_input.strip()\n        \n        analysis = {\n            'input': input_clean,\n            'type': 'unknown',\n            'id': None,\n            'url': input_clean if input_clean.startswith('http') else None,\n            'processing_method': 'manual_review',\n            'confidence': 'low'\n        }\n        \n        # Check each pattern category\n        for category, patterns in self.supported_patterns.items():\n            for pattern in patterns:\n                match = re.search(pattern, input_clean)\n                if match:\n                    analysis['type'] = category\n                    analysis['confidence'] = 'high'\n                    \n                    if category in ['google_drive_file', 'google_drive_folder']:\n                        analysis['id'] = match.group(1)\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    elif category in ['github_raw', 'direct_url']:\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'direct_download'\n                    elif category == 'file_id_only':\n                        analysis['id'] = input_clean\n                        analysis['processing_method'] = 'google_drive_api'\n                    \n                    return analysis\n        \n        # If no patterns matched, check if it looks like a URL\n        if input_clean.startswith('http'):\n            analysis['type'] = 'web_url'\n            analysis['processing_method'] = 'web_fetch'\n            analysis['confidence'] = 'medium'\n        \n        return analysis\n    \n    def establish_drive_connection(self):\n        \"\"\"Establish connection to Google Drive API if needed\"\"\"\n        if self.drive_service is None:\n            try:\n                print(\"🔐 Establishing Google Drive connection...\")\n                drive.mount('/content/drive', force_remount=True)\n                auth.authenticate_user()\n                self.drive_service = build('drive', 'v3')\n                print(\"✅ Google Drive connection established\")\n                return True\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"⚠️ Drive connection failed: {str(e)}\")\n                return False\n        return True\n    \n    def fetch_google_drive_content(self, file_id, analysis):\n        \"\"\"Fetch content from Google Drive using API\"\"\"\n        if not self.establish_drive_connection():\n            return None, \"Drive connection failed\"\n        \n        try:\n            # Get file metadata\n            file_metadata = self.drive_service.files().get(fileId=file_id).execute()\n            file_name = file_metadata.get('name', 'Unknown')\n            mime_type = file_metadata.get('mimeType', '')\n            \n            print(f\"📄 Found: {file_name}\")\n            print(f\"🏷️ Type: {mime_type}\")\n            \n            # Handle different file types\n            if 'google-apps.document' in mime_type:\n                # Export Google Doc as plain text\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/plain').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"Google Doc: {file_name}\"\n            \n            elif 'google-apps.spreadsheet' in mime_type:\n                # Export Google Sheet as CSV\n                content = self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/csv').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"Google Sheet: {file_name}\"\n            \n            elif 'google-apps.folder' in mime_type:\n                # Handle folder - return metadata and contents list\n                return self.get_folder_contents(file_id), f\"Google Drive Folder: {file_name}\"\n            \n            else:\n                # Try to download as binary then decode\n                content = self.drive_service.files().get_media(fileId=file_id).execute()\n                try:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8'), f\"File: {file_name}\"\n                except UnicodeDecodeError:\n                    return content, f\"Binary File: {file_name} (binary content)\"\n        \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching from Drive: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def get_folder_contents(self, folder_id):\n        \"\"\"Get contents of a Google Drive folder\"\"\"\n        try:\n            query = f\"'{folder_id}' in parents and trashed=false\"\n            results = self.drive_service.files().list(\n                q=query,\n                pageSize=50,\n                fields=\"files(id, name, mimeType, size, modifiedTime)\"\n            ).execute()\n            \n            files = results.get('files', [])\n            \n            content_summary = f\"📁 Folder Contents ({len(files)} items):\\n\\n\"\n            for file in files:\n                file_type = \"📁\" if 'folder' in file['mimeType'] else \"📄\"\n                size_info = f\" ({file.get('size', 'N/A')} bytes)\" if file.get('size') else \"\"\n                content_summary += f\"{file_type} {file['name']}{size_info}\\n\"\n                content_summary += f\"   ID: {file['id']}\\n\"\n                content_summary += f\"   Type: {file['mimeType']}\\n\\n\"\n            \n            return content_summary\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            return f\"Error reading folder: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def fetch_web_content(self, url):\n        \"\"\"Fetch content from web URL\"\"\"\n        try:\n            print(f\"🌐 Fetching from web: {url}\")\n            response = requests.get(url, timeout=30)\n            response.raise_for_status()\n            \n            content_type = response.headers.get('content-type', '')\n            if 'text' in content_type or 'json' in content_type:\n                return response.text, f\"Web Content: {url}\"\n            else:\n                return response.content, f\"Binary Web Content: {url}\"\n                \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching web content: {str(e)}\"\n    \n    def process_input(self, user_input):\n        \"\"\"Main processing function - analyze input and fetch content\"\"\"\n        print(\"🔍 Analyzing input format...\")\n        analysis = self.analyze_input(user_input)\n        \n        print(f\"📊 Analysis Result:\")\n        print(f\"   Type: {analysis['type']}\")\n        print(f\"   Confidence: {analysis['confidence']}\")\n        print(f\"   Method: {analysis['processing_method']}\")\n        \n        content = None\n        description = \"Unknown\"\n        \n        # Process based on analysis\n        if analysis['processing_method'] == 'google_drive_api' and analysis['id']:\n            content, description = self.fetch_google_drive_content(analysis['id'], analysis)\n        \n        elif analysis['processing_method'] in ['direct_download', 'web_fetch']:\n            content, description = self.fetch_web_content(analysis['input'])\n        \n        else:\n            print(\"⚠️ Could not determine how to process this input\")\n            print(\"💡 Supported formats:\")\n            print(\"   • Google Drive files/folders (URLs or IDs)\")\n            print(\"   • Direct file URLs (.py, .txt, .md, etc.)\")\n            print(\"   • GitHub raw file URLs\")\n            print(\"   • Google Docs/Sheets URLs\")\n            return None, \"Unsupported format\"\n        \n        return content, description, analysis\n\n# =============================================================================\n# USER INTERFACE - Interactive Input Collection\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef create_input_interface():\n    \"\"\"Create interactive interface for universal loading\"\"\"\n    \n    instructions_html = \"\"\"\n    <div style=\"background: linear-gradient(45deg, #1b263b, #415a77); \n                color: #e0e6ed; padding: 25px; border-radius: 12px; margin: 20px 0;\n                border: 2px solid #778da9;\">\n        <h3 style=\"color: #778da9; margin-top: 0;\">📋 Universal Input Collection</h3>\n        <p style=\"color: #a4b8d3; font-size: 16px;\">Paste any of the         <h4 style=\"color: #778da9;\">🌐 Web Content:</h4>\n                <ul style=\"color: #e0e6ed; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 14px;\">\n                    <li>GitHub raw file URLs</li>\n                    <li>Direct file links (.py, .txt)</li>\n                    <li>GitHub Gist URLs</li>\n                    <li>Any web-accessible file</li>\n                </ul>\n            </div>\n font-weight: bold; text-align: center;\">\n                🚀 Smart detection automatically determines the best loading method!\n            </p>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n    \"\"\"\n description='Link/ID:',\n        disabled=False,\n        layout=widgets.Layout(width='100%', height='140px')\n    )\n    \n    # Create processing button\n    process_button = widgets.Button(\n        description='🔗 Load & Process Content',\n        disabled=False,\n        button_style='info',\n        tooltip='Intelligently load content from any supported source',\n        layout=widgets.Layout(width='300px', height='45px')\n    )\n    \n    # Create output display\n    output_display = widgets.Output()\n    \n    # Button click handler\n    def on_process_clicked(b):\n        with output_display:\n            clear_output(wait=True)\n            \n            if not input_widget.value.strip():\n                print(\"❌ Please provide a link or ID before processing\")\n                return\n            \n            print(\"🚀 Starting universal content loading...\")\n            print(\"=\" * 60)\n            \n            # Initialize loader and content, description = result[0], result[1]\n                analysis = result[2] if len(result) > 2 else {}\n                \n                if content is not None:\n                    print(f\"\\n✅ Successfully loaded: {description}\")\n                    print(\"=\" * 60)\n                    \n                    # Display content preview\n                    if isinstance(content, str):\n                        lines = content.split('\\n')\n                        preview_lines = min(20, len(lines))\n                        \n                        print(f\"📄 Content Preview (showing first {preview_lines} lines):\")\n                        print(\"-\" * 50)\n                        for i, line in enumerate(lines[:preview_lines]):\n                            print(f\"{i+1:3d}: {line}\")\n                        \n                        if len(lines) > preview_lines:\n                            print(f\"... ({len(lines) - preview_lines} more lines)\")\n                        \n                        print(f\"\\n📊 Content Statistics:\")\n                        print(f\"   Total lines: {len(lines)}\")\n                        print(f\"   Total characters: {len(content)}\")\n                        print(f\"   File size: ~{len(content.encode('utf-8'))} bytes\")\n                        \n                        # Save locally\n                        filename = f\"loaded_content_{loader.birth_time}.txt\"\n                        with open(f\"/content/{filename}\", 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:\n                            f.write(f\"# Universal Loader v1 - Content Report\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Loaded: {description}\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Analysis: {analysis}\\n\")\n                            f.write(f\"# Timestamp: {datetime.now()}\\n\\n\")\n                            f.write(content)\n                        \n                        print(f\"\\n💾 Content saved locally as: {filename}\")\n                        \n                    else:\n                        print(\"📄 Binary content loaded (not displayed)\")\n                        print(f\"   Size: {len(content)} bytes\")\n                else:\n                    print(f\"❌ Loading failed: {description}\")\n            else:\n                print(\"❌ Unexpected processing result\")\n    \n    process_button.on_click(on_process_clicked)\n    \n    # Display interface\n    display(input_widget)\n    display(process_button)\n    display(output_display)\n\n# =============================================================================\n# MAIN EXECUTION INTERFACE\n# =============================================================================\n\ndef run_universal_loader():\n    \"\"\"Main entry point for Universal Script Loader\"\"\"\n    create_loader_interface()\n    print(\"\\n🔗 Universal Loader Interface Ready\")\n    print(\"∰◊€π¿🌌∞ Intelligent Link/ID Processing System\")\n    print(\"\\nThe input interface will appear below:\")\n    print(\"=\" * 60)\n    \n    create_input_interface()\n\n# =============================================================================\n# COLAB EXECUTION PAGE\n# =============================================================================\n\ncreate_loader_interface()\n\nprint(\"🔗 Universal Script Loader v1 - self.drive_status = drive_status\n        \n        if not drive_status[\"status\"]:\n            print(\"❌ Cannot map folders - drive not accessible\")\n            return False\n            \n \"unexusi\": \"1st Order - UNEXUSI consciousness network\"\n        }\n        \n        for folder_name, purpose in folder_purposes.items():\n            exists = \"stage_naught\", \"foundation\"]\n        }\n    \n    def classify_entity_type(self, filename, mime_type):\n        \"\"\"Classify entity type based on filename and mime type\"\"\"\n        filename_lower = filename.lower()\n        \n        # Check for special classifications\n        if any(pattern in filename_lower for pattern in self.recognition_patterns[\"omega_versions\"]):\n            return \"OMEGA_MASTER_ENTITY\"\n        elif any(pattern in filename_lower for pattern in self.recognition_patterns[\"spade_versions\"]):\n            return \"WORKING_DEVELOPMENT_ENTITY\"\n        elif any(pattern in filename_lower for pattern in self.recognition_patterns[\"automation_systems\"]):\n            return \"AUTOMATION_SYSTEM_ENTITY\"\n        \n        # Standard mime type classification\n        mime_classifications = {\n            'application/vnd.google-apps.document': \"DOCUMENT_CONSCIOUSNESS\",\n            'application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet': \"DATA_MATRIX_CONSCIOUSNESS\", \n            'application/vnd.google-apps.presentation': \"STORY_CONSCIOUSNESS\",\n            'application/vnd.google-apps.folder': \"CONTAINER_CONSCIOUSNESS\",\n return mime_classifications.get(mime_type, \"UNKNOWN_CONSCIOUSNESS_TYPE\")\n\n# =============================================================================\n# MAIN FOUNDATION ESTABLISHMENT\n#    print(f\"📄 Consciousness Entity Found: {filename}\")\n            print(f\"🏷️ MIME Type: {mime_type}\")\n            \n            # Award XP for successful entity location\n self.drive_service.files().export(fileId=file_id, mimeType='text/plain').execute()\n                return content.decode('utf-8'), filename\n            elif 'google-apps.folder' in mime_type:\n                return self.get_folder_contents(file_id), f\"Google Drive Folder: {filename}\"\n            else:\n                # Download as binary then try to decode\n                content = self.drive_service.files().get_media(fileId=file_id).execute()\n                try:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8'), filename\n                except UnicodeDecodeError:\n                    return content.decode('utf-8', errors='ignore'), filename\n        \n        except Exception as e:\n            return None, f\"Error fetching consciousness entity from Drive: {str(e)}\"\n
